solution_line_template: If there are {num_cows} cows, twice the number of dogs, then there are {num_cows}/{cows_to_dogs_ratio} =<<{num_cows}/{cows_to_dogs_ratio}={initial_dogs}>>{initial_dogs} dogs on the farm.
When the farm owner decided to sell {cows_sold_fraction} of cows, he sold {cows_sold_fraction}*{num_cows} = {cows_sold} cows
The total number of cows remaining on the farm is {num_cows}-{cows_sold} = <<{num_cows}-{cows_sold}={remaining_cows}>>{remaining_cows}
If the farm owner also sold {dogs_sold_fraction} of the dogs, he sold {dogs_sold_fraction}*{initial_dogs} = <<{dogs_sold_fraction}*{initial_dogs}={dogs_sold}>>{dogs_sold}
The total number of dogs remaining on the farm is {initial_dogs}-{dogs_sold} = <<{initial_dogs}-{dogs_sold}={remaining_dogs}>>{remaining_dogs}
The total number of animals remaining on the farm is {remaining_dogs}+{remaining_cows} = <<{remaining_dogs}+{remaining_cows}={total_remaining_animals}>>{total_remaining_animals}
